1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:



*California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

*Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

*California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

*Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name                 Process Chemical     Process Quantity(lbs.)

Ammonia Storage and Reactor  Anhydrous Ammonia    210,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 



1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet Cal

ARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Description



Buttonwillow Warehouse Company - Buttonwillow Service Yard is a fertilizer storage facility. The ammonia process is used to store and resell anhydrous ammonia as fertilizer and also to produce ammonium polyphosphate. 



The ammonia process operates as follows: Ammonia is supplied by a vendor into the ammonia storage tank. From there it is stored until a sale is made, at which time a Buttonwillow Service Yard employee transfers ammonia from the storage tank into a smaller trailer-mounted nurse tank. The nurse tanks are towed by trucks off site for the fertilizer application. 



In addition, the ammonia in the storage tank is used on select days for the production of ammonium polyphosphate. During ammonium phosphate production anhydrous ammonia is pumped from a large storage tank through piping and valves into a heat exchanger where the liquid ammonia is heated as it is used to cool ammonium polyphosphate. From there, the liquid ammonia continues to the reactor where it is mixed with super phosphoric acid. A chemical reaction occurs in the reactor which results in the formation of ammonium polyphosphate.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative rel

ease scenarios for the ammonia process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 



1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia process at the BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 210,000 lbs. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our  personnel monitor the ammonia process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia.



1.4 Five Year Accident History



BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has had one accidental release in the last five (5) years. A summary of the accident is included in the table below:



Release Date: June 10, 2013

Facility: Buttonwillow Service Yard

Description: Transfer operation procedure error and release

Contributing Cause(s: Human error

Corrective Action(s) Taken: Replace/improved ammonia hoses, additional training, Reduced the amount of personnel authorized to transfer ammonia



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:



*California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

*Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6

Planned Changes to Improve Safety



BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program BWC Buttonwillow Service Yard will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
